Title: Editing gene engineering to enhance function
Abstract: © 2018 by The American Society of Hematology.In this issue of Blood, Legut et al have tackled a major scientific challenge relating to T-cell engineering, with an unexpected outcome. They have demonstrated that CRISPR-mediated knockout of the native T-cell receptor (TCR) b chain dramatically improves the expression of inserted therapeutic ab and gd TCRs in comparison with the same TCRs inserted without endogenous TCR-b chain knockout. Although insertion of TCRs or chimeric antigen receptors (CARs) into the TCR locus has been reported previously, the significant improvement in functional avidity of TCR modified T cells shown here is novel.
IndexKeywords: Clustered Regularly Interspaced Short Palindromic Repeats
